attributes.action: No Charges to Freedom Passes. No Rush Hours Under Covid
attributes.additional_details: Govia Thameslink have explained that this move is to reduce congestion due to covid-19. This isn’t a good reason. Anybody will travel at this time if they can't work from home. This will therefore not ease congestion or assist with social distancing. By not only reversing this but making all possible jobs done at home, congestion on trains when people go to work will hopefully become easier
attributes.background: Since covid Govia Thameslink stopped all people’s freedom passes everyday until 9.30am. As a result these vulnerable people pay up to £8 when they travel. They must reverse this decision. The govt must give Emergency Funding for All Transport Services and make as many jobs as possible done at home.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Freedom Passes are the responsibility of Transport for London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
